methods.name: gas
methods.desc: gas is a dummy no-op call that can be used to pool-up resource references and opcode cost

methods.name: getNumValidators
methods.desc: Returns the current number of validators

args.name: owner
args.desc: The account (presumably cold-wallet) that owns the validator set

args.name: manager
args.desc: The account that manages the pool part. keys and triggers payouts.  Normally a hot-wallet as node sidecar needs the keys

args.name: nfdAppID
args.desc: Optional NFD App ID linking to information about the validator being added - where information about the validator and their pools can be found.

methods.name: addPool
methods.desc: Adds a new pool to a validator's pool set, returning the 'key' to reference the pool in the future for staking, etc.

methods.name: addStake
methods.desc: Adds stake to a validator pool.

args.name: stakedAmountPayment
args.desc: payment coming from staker to place into a pool

returns.desc: {ValidatorPoolKey}- The key of the validator pool.

methods.name: stakeUpdatedViaRewards
methods.desc: stakeUpdatedViaRewards is called by Staking Pools to inform the validator (us) that a particular amount of total stake has been removedfrom the specified pool.  This is used to update the stats we have in our PoolInfo storage.The calling App ID is validated against our pool list as well.

methods.name: stakeRemoved
methods.desc: stakerRemoved is called by Staking Pools to inform the validator (us) that a particular amount of total stake has been removedfrom the specified pool.  This is used to update the stats we have in our PoolInfo storage.The calling App ID is validated against our pool list as well.
